Certainly! Here are a few movies that showcase cutting-edge technology:

1. Gravity (2013) - As mentioned earlier, Gravity utilized new techniques in visual effects to create the illusion of zero gravity and give viewers an immersive and realistic experience.

2. The Jungle Book (2016) - The Jungle Book is a great example of how motion capture technology can be used to create lifelike digital characters. The movie utilized advanced motion capture techniques to capture the movements and expressions of real-life actors and turn them into realistic animal characters.

3. Interstellar (2014) - Interstellar features stunning visual effects that showcase the latest advancements in simulation and rendering technology. The movie also features a realistic depiction of a black hole, which was created using cutting-edge scientific simulations.

4. Blade Runner 2049 (2017) - Blade Runner 2049 utilized new techniques in visual effects, such as "reverse engineering," to seamlessly blend digital sets with live-action footage.

5. Avengers: Infinity War (2018) - Avengers: Infinity War features groundbreaking motion capture and animation techniques that were used to create the movie's many digital characters, including Thanos.

These are just a few examples, but there are many more movies out there that showcase cutting-edge technology in filmmaking.
